rev.comment: fixed category tree, moved sa category to peru cat
/* 21st Century */ Added some new information, but I think that this section needs to be re-worked on.
This has been discussed at WT:FOOTY. Table disproportionate to information communicated
/* 21st Century */ reverting good faith edit: the 2010 world cup qualification failure is discussed further down in the section

Reverting possible vandalism by [[Special:Contributions/Oraleguey|Oraleguey]] to version by AniRaptor2001. False positive? [[User:ClueBot/FalsePositives|Report it]]. Thanks, [[User:ClueBot|ClueBot]]. (789582) (Bot)
/* Uniform */ Truncated a tad the uniform section.
/* Players */ Adding period to the sentence.
/* Recent Call Ups */ Moving updated list to its appropiate article.
/* Rivalries */ Edited football rivalry between Peru and Chile, and Peru and Ecuador section. Added more accurate name.
/* Current squad */ Put the complete name of the football clubs. I don't understand why they are constantly shortened. Is it a wiki rule? Please explain on talk page.
/* From glory to decline */ As sad as it may sound, there has been no change since the 1980s. Peru just keeps getting worse.
/* 1970s golden generation */ took out wikilinks from peeps already in main article. standardizing pacific cup name.
/* Good games, few titles */ Added proper "i" to Spanish "Pacifico." Also making the name of cup standard.
/* Good games, few titles */ Grammar fixes.
/* 1930s golden generation */ Took out wikilinks from names in picture if they already appear in the text of the article.
/* Beginnings */ fixed location of better source (that replaces one of the unreliable sources mentioned in the FA review).
/* Managers */ Changing biased chart to a better description of Peru's managers.
/* Stadium */ Added a better picture of the stadium (one that actually shows the insides).
/* Good games, few titles */ Moving picture that would have a better fit at "Memorable Games."
/* Top 10 most successful */ deleted the wrong stat for one of them.
/* Top 10 most successful */ defining a draw and a win as equally successful is totally OR, and against the usual definition of success.
/* Notable players */ Added another free picture.
/* Current squad */ Removed Foreign links and wikilinks to es article. All links must be to Eng wiki articles; or references.
/* Notable players */ Truncated section by removing unecessary text (too much "team" mention) and other such things.
/* Records */ Included pic of Solano in records section. He's been Peru's captain and is third top goalscorer. Plus, the picture is free.
/* Players */ Updating WC article with updated information.
/* Records */ Europe XI is the correct name.
/* Players */ Please update the list on Peru's World Cup article.
Did another round of copy-editing with the program "PerfectIt" Not really sure what else could be done to improve the article.
Except for some few problems, the copy-edit program did not find much of anything. I'm not sure if this means the article is good or if the program was bad.
Using some free trial program to try and copy-edit the article. It might work (It's worth a shot).
/* Notable players */ Removing copyrighted image of Teofilo Cubillas. *Sighs* If only there was a free one...
/* Other tournaments and records */ Grammar fix.
/* Good games, few titles */ Grammar fix.
/* 1930s golden generation */ Grammar fix. Awesome information AniRaptor.
/* Beginnings */ going to try to standardize the english-spanish duality of names of organizations and cups and the like
/* 1930s golden generation */ corrected dates, added reference for Chile-Peru team
/* 1930s golden generation */ Beginning process of fixing wikilink problems.
/* Bibliography */ Last bit of sources added. Any more found are welcome.
/* Bibliography */ Here are some books for the bibliography.
/* References */ Making new section for book sources.
/* 21st Century */ Copyedit. Same as the last two.
/* World Cup record */ Joined paragraphs per Peer Review.
/* Present */ Mendoza is also wikilinked in the other section.
/* From glory to decline */ Velasquez is mentioned on the other section.
/* Memorable games */ "Albicelestes" or any other nickname for a national team other than Peru should not be used unless it is explained.
/* Records */ Non-free image that is not necessary for the article, per Peer Review.
/* 1970s golden generation */ Edited section as suggested by Peer Review. Made image smaller; thumb size was too small and didn't allow for some of the detail to be seen.
/* History */ Per [[MOS:HEAD]] renamed sections mentioning "football" and "national team." Mixed two sections together to form a more solid one.
/* Memorable games */ Took out "trashed" and replaced with "defeated."
/* Memorable games */ en dash and minor c/e
/* Records */ removed terminal period from non-sentence in caption
/* Records */ nbsps and an en dash
/* Other tournaments and records */ grammar fix.
On reflection "throughout its history" adds nothing
rearranging sections to match [[Scotland national football team]]: world cup and southam cup records
fixed copa del pacifico redlinks and added english translations where appropriate
added note about flag color=team color
/* 1930s Golden generation */ Not sure if the inclusion of the word "notably" makes this an exceptional claim.
Corrected article as per Oldelpaso's first three points
/* From glory to decline */ Removing the Nehru cup reference; Peru defeated India in their match, but did not win any title!
grammar edit. "Many" is too broad of a word.
/* Current Squad */ Including the full name of clubs. It lessens the article size and is better to see the team's full name.
/* Creation of national team */ clean up
Trying out a slightly different structure for the intro, thoughts?
/* Copa América record */ Almost done with the checking of access dates.
/* Creation of national team */ Beginning to re-check all the sources with missing access dates. Re-dating them to current date if found to still be working and accurate.

/* Players */ The whole list of peeps makes the article way too big. There's a direct link to the additional players. Update that page with the additional players. Only current players should be here.
/* Current Squad */ Wikilinks about particular people should only link to Wikipedia articles in English. No Spanish wiki or foreign linking.
broke the boxes on that last one
/* Memorable games */ worked on this section
/* World Cup record */ Reworded part on 1982 WC. Added international results in order to verify the success of the team in the Africa/Europe tour.
/* 1970s Golden generation */ Found reference (within the article) for the statement on Peru causing surprise and other whatnot in the 1970s.
/* Good football, few titles */ Moved around things in the paragraph. Didn't add any sources as none were necessary. Claims not found in sources were removed.
/* 1930s Golden generation */ took out peacock term.
/* Rivalries */ Expanded on information regarding the bicycle kick, as suggested.
/* Rivalries */ wordiness, and this phrase needs clarification as to how the origins are disputed
/* Introduction of football */ issues like this indicate that the article probably needs a good copy-edit
not sure why that is abbreviated, and this should be an en dash
Removed a non-free image and posted a rationale in defense for the usage of the other 5 remaining non-free images.
/* Current manager */ Shortened article size by removing 2007 and 2008 results from Chemo's record. These are now on the Managers of Peru wikipage. Only 2009 results will be kept.
/* Other tournaments and records */ Improved grammar and style of Kirin Cup paragraph.
/* Managers */ Took out image based on the Wikipedia:Image use policy.
/* Stadium */ merged small subsection, too little text to have it separated IMHO
/* Copa América record */ Improve grammar and style.
/* Other tournaments and records */ Improved section on other tournaments.
/* Notable players */ Updated the "famed midfielders" part. Solano is unofficially retired from the team.
A splendid job was done improving the opening section, but some key things were left out (Football rivalry, specific participations in the WC, Olympic games, and Copa America wins).
/* 1930s Golden generation */ This template is not really necessary.
Peru is known internationally and domestically as La Blanquirroja.
/* Current manager */ Made mathematical calculations on Chemo's failure. Ladies and gentlemen, we're officially living in historic times: Chemo is Peru's worst Coach ever.
/* Present */ reworded phrase regarding the investigation of players due to partying (Sources do not apply to current times, though they are recent).
/* Present */ reworked to improve grammar, copy etc. sure is a terrible time for the team :(
/* Present */ Added recent information that gives a definite closing to the history of the squad (for now, until more terrible news come).
Rescuing orphaned refs ("The Star" from rev 295795446)
updated the misery of the 2010 qualifiers
/* World Cup record */ "By Some" is a very suseptible phrase. Removing it.
/* World Cup record */ grammar (+ removed para which is already covered in the body of the article)
/* World Cup record */ they were not favourites
/* World Cup record */ english - spelling and grammar
/* World Cup record */ blogs are not reliable references and this is just an opinion

i made it better an truthful

/* World Cup record */ cut down wording
/* Notable players */ Added word "generally" to satisfy the meticulous few that get apparent heart attacks at reading something they don't agree with.
/* Notable players */ Hopefully solved the problem, with suggestion from LibStar.
Date maintenance tags and general fixes
/* Copa América record */ Removed non-free picture for a free picture.
/* Notable players */ POV statement that actually was identified during GA review, discuss.
/* Copa América record */ Truncated the chart. Too many absences that can be easily summarized.
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 281624420. Yet again, GA Review upheld the idea that no flag is needed in this part of the article. Read the review peeps, it's not that long!
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 281502231. Read the discussion in the talk page. The GA Review allowed for the information to be moved to this section. It is not POV. Learn the HISTORY of the team.
no it's straight opinion that is [[WP:POV]]. I'm sure other South American football sides would claim the same
/* Top-Scorers for World Cup Qualifiers */ This would go best with the FIFA World Cup Qualifiers page. Not this one.
/* Notable players */ Do not remove such text without priorly discussing the matter. It is a historical statement that does not necessarily adjust to recentism.
that's a POV, if true they would be in the world cup
[[WP:UNDO|Undid]] revision 278468462. The table was set up in this manner as a result of the GA review. Do not change it.
